help.name: infant_recon_all
help.description: This program performs recon-all on infants (0-2yrs). Cite Zöllei et al., FreeSurfer image processing pipeline for infant clinical MRI images, HBM2017, Vancouver, Canada while journal submission is pending. Make sure that SUBJECTS_DIR is properly set before calling this script.

required-flagged.explanation: FreeSurfer subject name as found in $SUBJECTS_DIR. This identifies the subject that is to be processed. The input file, unless indicated otherwise, shoudl be located in $SUBJECTS_DIR/$s/mprage.nii.gz before processing is started.
Age of the FreeSurfer subject that is to be processed.

This flag indicates that the subject to be processed is a newborn. All newborn subjects from the training data set will be used. No age input is needed if this flag is set. By default this flag is set to 0.

arguments.optional-flagged:
--kneigh num Number of training subjects to be used to acquire prior information about segmentation. Default is set to 4.
--outdir directory Name of the output directory where all the reconall results are written. The default is $SUBJECTS_DIR/$s/, where $s is the subject id of the subject to be reconned.
--aparc This option indicates that the tarining subjects have cortical parcellations.
--masked masked_input_image This flag indicates that there exists a skullstripped version of the input image and that should be used as the input. This means that the skull-stripping step is skipped during the processing.
--force
--avoidtraining
--MI
--gmwm2
Cleanup Arguments --nocleanup Do not delete temporary files (default is 0). If this option is set, make sure you have ~2G space in the output directory. --keepelreg
